alert.note: Alert for Teton (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 26 at 10:35AM MDT until further notice by NWS Riverton
info.description: ...The Flood Advisory is extended for the following rivers in Wyoming... Gros Ventre River near Kelly affecting Teton County. .Temperatures will remain around or slightly above normal through the weekend, with scattered afternoon and evening showers and thunderstorms. Therefore, active snowmelt persists in the mountains, increasing water flows in the headwaters of the Gros Ventre River above Kelly. ...FLOOD ADVISORY FOR SNOWMELT NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Flooding caused by snowmelt continues. * WHERE...Gros Ventre River near Kelly. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 7.0 feet, Bankfull stage. At 8.0 feet, Flood stage. Flooding of low lying areas. Highway 89 pathway begins to flood. At 9.0 feet, Flooding of low lying areas increases and becomes more widespread. Highway 89 pathway is totally inundated with water. Water may begin to flow through Gros Ventre Campground sites that are near the river. River begins undercutting the Gros Ventre Road. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:00 AM MDT Friday, May 26, the stage was 7.0 feet. - Forecast...No forecast is available for this location at this time. - Action stage is 7.0 feet. - Flood stage is 8.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. The fast-moving water may have eroded the soil beneath the bank. Also, do not attempt to swim in the river, as the water is swift and cold. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/riverton.
